intro: Hieracium solidagineum subsp. neosonchoides, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often lobed. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in flat-topped clusters, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. This subspecies is notable for its adaptability to a variety of soil types and its role in supporting pollinators.
